text: Papyrus Oxyrhynchus 5101, (designated as P.Oxy.LXXVII 5101, LDAB 140272 or Rahlfs 2227) is a papyrus roll which now only survives as small pieces. It is written in Koine Greek of the Septuagint (LXX). It has been palaeographycally dated to have been written between 50 and 150 C.E. == Description == === Tetragrammaton === The manuscript contains the tetragrammaton to represent the Divine Name of God (Yahweh) written in palaeo-Hebrew script.Francisco A. J. Hoogendijk. Review of: A. Benaissa (2011) The Oxyrhynchus Papyri, Volume LXXVII (2015)Michael P. Theophilos. Recently Discovered Greek Papyri and Parchment of the Psalter from the Oxford Oxyrhynchus Manuscripts: Implications for Scribal Practice and Textual Transmission . Australian Catholic University. == References == Category:Religious literature Category:Septuagint manuscripts Category:1st-century biblical manuscripts Category:2nd-century biblical manuscripts
title: Papyrus Oxyrhynchus 5101
